revised_title: Homology of the Head-Kidney in Birds and Amphibia
tldr: The authors discuss the similarities between the development of the anterior part of the Mullerian duct in birds and the changes in the open extremity of the segmental duct in Amphibia, leading to the formation of the head-kidney. They also mention the presence of a peculiar body, the glomerulus, in both Amphibia and birds, suggesting a possible homologous structure.
